page.title: 08TRANSPORT MAINLAND FERRY
page.content: There is a ferry service from Yarmouth to Lymington across the Solent for vehicles and people. It is a roll-on roll-off ferry with a ramp at each end In 1984 there were 13,950 ferry crossings carrying 1,270,716 passengers,240,887 cars,32,706 lorries and 1801 coaches. It runs every hour in the winter and every half hour in the summer during the day. It has lifebelts and lifeboats and a searchlight to shine in the sea to look for people if they fall overboard It has a radar and a foghorn for foggy days and 2 funnels,2 masts and flags. There are lots of seats inside and outside.You can get food and a drink on the ferry. It takes milk from our farm to the mainland.The ferry brings us ice cream and other food, toys and petrol. The journey takes 30 minutes.
